sentences.english: Fat daughter comes to challenge, in a battle royal, miscarriage of white jade duckweed.
sentences.chinese: 胖閨女上門挑戰，一場混戰中，白玉萍小產了。

sentences.english: Do you know that I never miscarried?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我從來沒有小產嗎？

sentences.english: Ever run out of cards before developers can unilaterally cancelling the contract?
sentences.chinese: 小產證辦出前開發商能否單方解除合同？

sentences.english: Many women who miscarry eventually have healthy babies.
sentences.chinese: 許多曾經小產的女人最終都生下了健康的寶寶。

sentences.english: It is uncommon for healthy animals to cast their young.
sentences.chinese: 健康的小動物小產是不平常的事。

sentences.english: He is very weak from last week's abortion.
sentences.chinese: 他上週剛小產，身子虛得很。

definition: gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
